title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there are no children nodes listed.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes should be listed.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page. 
3. Change the data source to a different one. 
4. Observe that there are no children (database/table/column) nodes listed. 
5. Close the data set editor and reopen it. Ensure that the children nodes are now listed.
